bibl.title: Melbourne Botanic Garden, ¶ 30 January 1872. ¶ ¶ Again, noble Sir, I am sending you a variety of seeds of trees, which you might find welcome for the test plantations in the warmer parts of Dalmatia....

encodingDesc.p: The file data/letters/1870-9/1872/72-01-30-final.doc was converted from Microsoft Word format into TEI using an XProc pipeline.

head.supplied: Melbourne Botanic Garden, ¶ 30 January 1872. ¶ ¶ Again, noble Sir, I am sending you a variety of seeds of trees, which you might find welcome for the test plantations in the warmer parts of Dalmatia....

div.p: Eduard Fenzl Nachlass, Archiv der Universität Wien, Vienna.
MS bears letterhead of M's proposed baronial coat of arms. Melbourne, im bot. Garten

Wiederum sende ich Ihnen, edler Herr, einige Sorten Baumsamen, welche Ihnen für die Culturversuche in den wärmern Gegenden Dalmatiens willkommen sein möchten. Das Packet ist mit der diesmaligen Monatspost abgegangen.

Sr Excellenz der Feldmarschall Lieut. Hr. Baron Jochmus von Cotignola hat mich zum weitern Senden ermuntert, u. bemerkt in seinem letzt monatlichen Briefe, dass der Rücktritt des Ministers von Schaefle diese im Ministerium des Handels u Ackerbaus eingeleitete Angelegenheit in ihrer Entwicklung nicht stören würde.
Im Augenblick bin ich nicht ganz wohl. So bitte ich die Kürze dieses Schreibens gütig hinnehmen zu wollen.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Ich sende Ihnen die letzte Nummer der Fragmenta. Der geschlossene 7te Band soll Ihnen demnächst zugehen.

Again, noble Sir, I am sending you a variety of seeds of trees, which you might find welcome for the test plantations in the warmer parts of Dalmatia.
See also M to E. Fenzl, 24 January 1871(in this edition as 71-01-24a), and M to E. Fenzl, 14 October 1871. The packet has been dispatched with this monthly mail.

His Excellency Lieut. Field Marshal Baron Jochmus von Cotignola, has encouraged me to continue sending further transmissions, and remarked in his last monthly letter,
Letter not found. that the resignation of Minister von Schaefle
i.e. Schäffle; see also M to E. Fenzl, 14 October 1871. would not disrupt this matter, initiated by the Ministry for Trade and Agriculture, in its further development.
At present I am not very well. Consequently I ask you to be so kind and accept the brevity of this letter.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p:
I am sending you the latest number of the Fragmenta.
B72.01.01. The completed 7th volume will shortly be sent to you.
In a letter of 22 February 1872, William Woolls alerted Edward Ramsay to a review of the complete volume in Sydney morning herald, 22 February 1872, p. 3 (ML MSS.563/3 E. P. Ramsay papers, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney). Although the review is unsigned, it is almost certainy by Woolls.
